intro: Lippia bicolor, commonly known as Mexican mint or blue mist shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, branching stems and opposite leaves that are often gray-green in color. It produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, often blooming in clusters. Lippia bicolor is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
